summary: A lot of different card designs, nice app

description: I like to play the 'Klondike' card game but I also try some of the others with tihs game pack. Works fine for me and I play it a lot during the day.

There is no five-star solitaire game for Linux (that I know of), but KPat is well ahead of AisleRiot and any other flavor I've tried. It's missing one game I like to play occasionally (Montana), but it's got my favorite (Spider) and two others I enjoy (Klondike, Freecell). I wish it were a little smarter about knowing where I want a card to go -- so I don't have to drag it every time, risking carpal tunnel injury -- but it's way smarter than AisleRiot, at least in Freecell and Klondike.
summary: Best Solitaire I've Found for Linux

description: Certainly works better than AisleRiot. It has all the features it needs, and a solver is nice.

I'm running this on Ubuntu 19.10, live persistent on a USB stick. Several apps don't run once installed. The solution I've found is to check the permissions here in Ubuntu Software and toggle them all on.

If an app you've managed to get running like this doesn't run subsequently you can try returning to Ubuntu Software and toggling the permissions off. Then on again once the app's running.

I'm not clear why this works, but it seems to.

-- 
Chris
summary: Fixing Kpat when it won't run

description: yyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyy

Freecell typically has a breezy, not too interesting opening and a far too simple end game. The middle game gets interesting sometimes but is mostly self-explanatory or just pure stuckness.

KPat changes all that. With an absolutely key feature: The Solver. 

The main function of the Solver is to tell you, when you're staring at what looks like stuckness, whether or not the game is actually winnable. You hit some really interesting puzzles like this. Often you can puzzle for minutes in front of cards that look completely stuck which the Solver knows to be winnable. 

And if you can't work it out, the Solver can play it through to the end with you. You can stop the Solver's autoplay at any point and wind back to where you were to try to follow the moves.

And if the Solver tells you a position is unwinnable you can always wind back to where it was last winnable. I don't regard this as cheating because the nub of the game is hitting those knotty moments when the Solver knows how to win and you don't.

Without the Solver, Freecell is a mostly mindless game. With the Solver it can be really fascinating.

-- 
Chris
summary: Why Kpat's is a great version of Freecell

description: It's much more better then the preinstalled Aisleriot Solitaire and it also has sounds & better graphic, when you win theres a card win animation and i dont see that on other solitaire games on ubuntu software. Also you can changed the theme and card to make it match your style you choose. Lots of game choice's on a menu that i like, give it a try it's the best one on ubuntu software and please when you install reset pc and it will run.
summary: Very Good, I like this Solitaire

description:
IMHO this offers the only version of FreeCell worth playing. FreeCell typically gives you an easy opening and a more or less automatic end game with the only real interest arising in the middle game, and then only sometimes.

But the problem is, when you hit what looks like a possibly interesting puzzle in the middle game, most versions of FreeCell leave you not knowing that it might just be insoluable and you'd just be wasting your time. In this version the Solver will tell you whether the game is soluble---so you're left with an interesting puzzle.

Depending on how you want to play it, thanks to the Undo feature you can back out of an insoluable position and pick up again when it comes back to life, giving you the chance to hit a properly interesting middle game puzzle.

If you come to a puzzle that the Solver says is soluable but you can't solve, this version allows you to save the position so that you can come back to it later. And/or you can switch to Demo and get the solver to show you how it should be done.

The Solver and the Undo and Save features really make this a game worth spending time with.

-- 
Chris

В общем-то неплохие карты для KDE, есть возможность выбора нескольких изображений карт (скинов), но при запуске игры под KDE Neon появляется процесс /usr/bin/baloo_file, который загружает процессор на 100%. При закрытии приложения загрузка процессора падает до нормальных значений.

Всем рекомендую игру. Снимает напряжение, стрессы, просто отдыхаешь.
Но почему то у меня она перестала открываться. А так хочется иногда поиграть, отвлечься от проблемм...
